snippet: Injections of steroids near the spine have been linked to other rare but devastating complications, including nerve damage, paralysis and strokes.
abstract: Outbreak of fungal meningitis that has killed 14 people and sickened 156 more has focused attention on risk of infection from steroid spinal injections, which have long been linked to other rare but devastating complications; use of such injections has mushroomed even as clinical trials have found only modest evidence that they help.
lead_paragraph: Injections of steroids near the spine have been linked to other rare but devastating complications, including nerve damage, paralysis and strokes.

headline.seo: Spinal Steroid Injections Have History of Trouble
headline.main: Before a Wave of Meningitis, Shots Were Tied to Risks
headline.print_headline: Seeking Injections for Pain Relief, and Finding Themselves in Pain for Life
